summary: This bill, H.R. 3501, amends the Social Security Act to incorporate cognitive impairment detection into Medicare annual wellness visits and initial preventive physical examinations. It mandates the use of specific cognitive impairment detection tools recommended by the National Institute on Aging and requires documentation of the assessment results. The bill highlights the increasing prevalence of Alzheimer's disease and its impact on individuals, caregivers, and the healthcare system, citing relevant statistics and the financial burden of dementia.
